visualElements.title: Visual Elements
visualElements.description: Details of the visual aspects of the screenplay that contribute to the story's setting, characters, and atmosphere.

elements.description: **The physical location where the story takes place, described in scene headings or sluglines. This includes interior (INT.) and exterior (EXT.) locations, and can specify the time of day.**

params.details: Additional descriptions using multiple hyphens, subheadings, or specific geographical information. **Time of day should only be specified if integral to the story**.

elements.description: **The clothing and accessories worn by characters, which convey information about their identity, social status, and the time period.**

params.description: Detailed notes on clothing, accessories, hair, makeup and how they convey character traits or story elements.
params.timePeriod: The era or specific time the costumes represent.

elements.description: **Objects used by characters that are significant to the plot, and are often capitalized in action lines in the script to emphasize their importance.**

params.description: Specific details about the prop, its appearance and its significance to the story.
params.useCase: How and when the prop is used.

elements.description: **The way the story is visually captured through camera angles, lighting, and movement. Includes camera shots, angles, and movements.**

params.notes: Additional details, including when to use specific shots and when to avoid them. **Screenwriters should generally avoid specifying shots, unless also directing.**

elements.description: **Techniques used to create visual illusions or enhance the story, including practical and visual effects (VFX).**

params.description: Specifics about what the special effect is supposed to achieve and how it appears on screen.
params.timePeriod: If the special effects are meant to suggest a particular time period.

cinematography.title: Cinematography
cinematography.description: Details of how the story is visually captured through camera angles, lighting, and movement.

elements.description: Different types of camera shots used to capture the scene.

params.notes: Additional details on when to use specific shots and their impact on the scene.

elements.description: Different types of camera angles used to capture the scene.

params.notes: Additional details on when to use specific angles and their impact on the scene.

elements.description: Different types of lighting used to create the desired mood and atmosphere.

params.notes: Additional details on when to use specific lighting techniques and their impact on the scene.

elements.description: Different types of camera movements used to capture the scene.

params.notes: Additional details on when to use specific movements and their impact on the scene.
